cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 325 miles SE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest through the Bahamas, forecast to run very near or along Florida’s east coast and then continue northward just offshore the southeast U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Very near the east-central Florida coast (around Cape Canaveral area) – a direct coastal scrape more likely than an inland landfall

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from north of Fernandina Beach FL to Edisto Beach SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from north of Golden Beach FL to Fernandina Beach FL, including the entire east-central Florida coastline
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast from Deerfield Beach through Cape Canaveral to Fernandina Beach, with surge and wind impacts extending northward into Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (possibly sustained 90–110 mph with higher gusts) expected late Thu night into Fri morning as the eye passes just offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft above ground possible around Port Canaveral with larger breaking waves on top, creating significant inundation in low-lying areas.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches with localized totals up to 10 inches, producing flash-flood potential and ponding on port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, possible coastal erosion, scattered tornadoes embedded in outer rainbands.
